content:
E/ICEF/R.354
Page 1 of 4 pages
PLAN OF OPERATIONS FOR THE PROVISION OF EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES BY UNICEF FOR THE PRODUCTION OF TRIPLE VACCINE IN TAIWAN PROVINCE OF THE REPUBLIC OF CHINA TO IMPLEMENT A MASS IMMUNIZATION CAMPAIGN AGAINST DIPHTHERIA, TETANUS AND PERTUSSIS
The Government of the Republic of China, hereinafter referred to as "the Government", and the World Health Organization, hereinafter referred to as "the Organization", desiring to give effect to the Resolutions of the United Nations and of the Organi- zation regarding an Expanded Program of Technical Assistance for Economic Develop- ment, and the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund, hereinafter referred to as "UNICEF",
Being desirous of obtaining mutual agreement concerning a mass immunization campaign against Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis in Taiwan Province of the Republic of China for which UNICEF will provide sufficient equipment and supplies for the pro- duction of triple vaccine, particularly with reference to the purpose of the project and the responsibilities which shall be assumed by each of the parties,
Declaring that those responsibilities shall be fulfilled in a spirit of friendly cooperation,
HAVE AGREED AS FOLLOWS:
許躍薾
0019
140 ARICE 13.82
The Basic Agreement concluded between the Government and UNICEF on 19 July 1950 provides the basis for relationships between the Government and UNICEF in this project, and the articles of this Plan of Operations should be interpreted in the light of that basic agreement.
ARTICLE II
OBJECTIVES
The Government, with the help of the Organization and UNICEF, has the following objectives in connection with this project:
1. To produce sufficient triple vaccine to immunize all children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years (approximately 2, 400, 000).
2. To immunize within three years all children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years against Diphtheria, Tetanus and Pertussis, by means of a mass immunization campaign.
3. To integrate the immunization of all children between the ages of 6 months and 10 years into the routine health services of the Province.
ARTICLE III PLAN OF ACTION
The objectives of this plan of operations are to be achieved by:
1. The installation of UNICEF equipment in the Taiwan Serum Vaccine Laboratory (for which complementary equipment is being provided by the U.S. Mutual Security Agency).
Academia Historica
